DRAMSimII::queue

DRAMSimII::queue< T > Class Template Reference

the queue template class, a circular queue push/pop are O(1) operations, while random insertions are O(n) operations More...

#include <queue.h>

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 queue (const queue< T > &a)
 copy constructor copy the existing queue, making copies of each element
 queue (const unsigned size, const bool preallocate=false)
 constructor create a queue of a certain size and optionally fill it with empty elements
 ~queue ()
 destructor remove the elements and delete them before removing the rest of the queue
void resize (unsigned size, bool preallocate=false)
 change the size of the queue remove all existing elements and create a new queue of a different size
bool push (T *item)
 add an item to the back of the queue issue a warning if the element is null false if the queue is already full to the tail pointer position and remove from the head
T * acquire_item ()
 treat this queue like an object pool and retrieve an item if there is no available object, then create one
T * pop ()
 remove the item at the front of the queue
const T * front () const
 get a pointer to the item at the head of the queue similar to peek()
const T * back () const
 to get a pointer to the item most recently inserted into the queue
unsigned size () const
 get the number of entries currently in this queue
unsigned get_depth () const
 get the number of entries this queue can hold
T * read (const unsigned offset) const
 get a pointer to the item at this offset without removing it
void release_item (T *item)
 release item into pool This is useful for when the queue holds preallocated pieces of memory and one would like to store them when they are not in use
bool insert (T *item, const int offset)
 this function makes this queue a non-FIFO queue. Allows insertion into the middle or at any end
unsigned freecount () const
 the number of entries still available in this queue
bool isFull () const
 whether or not there is room for any more entries in this queue
bool isEmpty () const
 whether or not this queue has no entries in it
queue< T > & operator= (const queue< T > &right)
 assignment operator overload moves all the objects from the rhs object to the lhs object

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class DRAMSimII::queue< T >

the queue template class, a circular queue push/pop are O(1) operations, while random insertions are O(n) operations

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class T>
DRAMSimII::queue< T >::queue ( const unsigned  size,
const bool  preallocate = false 
) [inline, explicit]

constructor create a queue of a certain size and optionally fill it with empty elements

Parameters:
size the depth of the circular queue whether or not to fill the queue with blank elements, defaults to false

Member Function Documentation

void DRAMSimII::queue< T >::resize ( unsigned  size,
bool  preallocate = false 
) [inline]

change the size of the queue remove all existing elements and create a new queue of a different size

Parameters:
size the depth to set the queue to
preallocate whether or not to fill the queue with blank elements, defaults to false

template<class T>
bool DRAMSimII::queue< T >::push ( T *  item  )  [inline]

add an item to the back of the queue issue a warning if the element is null false if the queue is already full to the tail pointer position and remove from the head

Parameters:
item the item to be inserted into the queue

template<class T>
T* DRAMSimII::queue< T >::acquire_item (  )  [inline]

treat this queue like an object pool and retrieve an item if there is no available object, then create one

Returns:
a new item which may or may not be initialized

template<class T>
T* DRAMSimII::queue< T >::pop (  )  [inline]

remove the item at the front of the queue

Returns:
the item at the head of the queue, NULL if the queue is empty

template<class T>
const T* DRAMSimII::queue< T >::front (  )  const [inline]

get a pointer to the item at the head of the queue similar to peek()

Returns:
a pointer to the item at the front of the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty
